content.description: The graph below depicts the dose response curves for three common bacteria and a newly discovered bacterium found in streams near certain agricultural properties.
content.question: If all four of the bacteria species shown in the graph are equally likely to contaminate agricultural products at a dose of <math alttext="10 to the power 2 C F U " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></msup><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>C</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, regulating which of the following species would have the greatest effect in reducing the likelihood of illness in humans?

choices.label: Salmonella <math alttext="s p p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Salmonella <math alttext="s p p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
